title: [SHOWCASE] Visual programming and drawing library based on SkiaSharp
body:
Just FYI, 

we are very, very grateful that this library exists. We've waited several years for such a project to emerge in the .NET landscape.

Today, SkiaSharp is the basis of the graph editor, HelpBrowser and several other parts of the UI of our new visual programming language for the .NET ecosystem. It was released just a few days ago:

https://visualprogramming.net/

We've also created an extensive node library that covers almost all features of SkiaSharp. This might be one of the most interactive and fun way to play around with SkiaSharp:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1094716/78370114-82ffd480-75c6-11ea-8589-becc877f829a.png)

It comes with many HowTo's:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1094716/78372960-36b69380-75ca-11ea-87c0-93d311b150d1.png)

that look like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1094716/78373323-c0fef780-75ca-11ea-95ea-9592f527da56.png)
 
Is there any place where you gather projects that use SkiaSharp?
